SEARCH
Package parade

Class ScoreCalculator

java.lang.Object
parade.ScoreCalculator
public class ScoreCalculator extends Object
Calculates and manages the scores of players in the Parade game.

Scoring is determined by evaluating each player's collected cards. For each color:

  • The player(s) with the most cards of that color only count the number of cards.
  • Other players sum the values of the cards in that color.
  • In 2-player games, the majority rule requires a margin of 2 to apply.

Example usage: 

 ScoreCalculator sc = new ScoreCalculator(playerList);
 sc.printLosers();
 ArrayList<Player> winners = sc.findWinners();

  • Constructor Details

    • ScoreCalculator

      public ScoreCalculator(PlayerList pl)
      Constructs a ScoreCalculator and initializes the score tracking.

      This constructor retrieves the list of players from the given PlayerList and initializes their scores to zero before calculating them.

      Parameters:
      pl - The PlayerList containing all players in the game.

  • Method Details

    • findWinners

      public ArrayList<Player> findWinners()
      Finds the player(s) with the lowest total score.
      Returns:
      A list of winning Players.

    • printWinners

      public void printWinners()
      Prints the winner(s) of the game based on the lowest score.

      In case of a tie, all tied players are displayed.

    • printAllScores

      public void printAllScores()
      Prints out the score of each player.

      Useful for post-game summary.
